dialogues.FRED:
[1]
[2]Wil-ma. Wil-ma? How about a great big good morning kiss for your Freddy-weddy? 
[3]Dino!   Dino, cut it out -- ! 
[4]Dino, that's enough -- here, look, Daddy has a nice dino bone for you, just please stop it -- 
[5]Oooh, Dino, look -- there's a nice big dino bone laying out on the front lawn -- ! 
[6]-- Gosh, look at that adorable little female dino -- 
[7]-- That animal's gonna kill me with kindness. Do you know we're out of dino treats? 
[8]And what's wrong with my leftovers? 
[9]That's right, sweetheart. The only thing that's gonna eat you up is -- me! 
[10]Pebbles, don't worry. These stories are very exaggerated. Like, you know, the boogyman? There's no such thing as a huge, inhuman reptile that attacks without warning -- 
[11]-- Oh, look, everybody, the mailman is here -- 
[12]Thanks, Wilma... 
[13]Arnold! Arnold! Don't aim at the house -- please, not at the house -- 
[14]Yeah.   What else can go wrong? 
[15]'Bye, little sweetheart. 'Bye, big sweetheart. 
[16]What's nice about it? 
[17]This is the third ragtop this year ... say, shouldn't you be at work? 
[18]You got fired, didn't ya? 
[19]Yeah, I know, I know, those crazy inventions of yours. Be honest with me, Barn... tell me one thing you invented that really caught on. 
[20]You invented fire? 
[21]Yeah, but did any one of them ever put bread on the table? How long are you and Betty gonna live on those penny-ante royalties you get? 
[22]If you ask me, pal, you're just blowing smoke up your own volcano... 
[23]Two coo-coo berries?   You made of money, Barney? 
[24]Barney, why don't you try inventing a brain for yourself! Look at what you did to -- 
[25]Okay, you fixed a dented hood. But you call that a living? Face it, pal, this is the Stone Age, and it's a dino eat dino world. You want my advice? 
[26]You stick with me today, cruise on down to the quarry and fill out a job application. I'm a big man there, Barney -- 
[27]I'm serious, pal. Me and Mr. Slate are just like this -- 
[28]-- just like that. I know, I know -- you're not a clock-punching guy -- but face it, Barney -- it's time to grow up and put your nose to the grindstone, batten down the hatches and join the ratasaurus race with the rest of us. It's time to retire those dreams. 
[29]Barney.   Look. 
[30]Remember the old days, Barn? We used to race our go-carts here to impress the girls. 
[31]Hey. Since when do I have to be consistent? 
[32]Sergeant Feldspar, I... I wasn't speeding... honest... 
[33]Well, Sergeant, if you don't have a radar reading, I guess we'll -- -- justbeonourway -- ! 
[34]Barney, you won't regret this -- hiya, Al -- fixing dents in cars is one thing, a career's another. Here, you're getting in on the ground floor of the first footstep of a new leaf -- hi, Wally, how's the old backhand? And with a guy like me ta show you the ropes, you can skip all the red tape, all the malarky, all the dino doo -- 
[35]Hiya, Shirley. This is my very special neighbor and pal Barney Rubble. He needs an application form, okay? 
[36]My pleasure, Shirl.    Anytime. 
[37]No problem. 
[38]Well, Barn, what did I tell you? When you're in with Flintstone, you're in like Flint. 
[39]Not again... 
[40]All right, Piltdown, that's enough! You're endangering your fellow workers! 
[41]Says me, Fred Flintstone -- shop steward of Amalgamated Neolithic Workers 101. 
[42]Whoa, whoa, big fella -- 
[43]You're on report, Piltdown! If it's up to me you'll be pushing a wheelbarrow! 
[44]Fat butt? Hold me back, Barney -- -- Barney, hold me back -- 
[45]Yeah.  That's right. I mean -- this ain't over, Piltdown. Come on, guys. Let's clean up the mess. 
[46]Barney!   Grab that line!   Hurry! 
[47]Oh boy.    Goodbye pension fund -- 
[48]Barney, shut up -- Mr. Slate -- Mr. Slate -- are you all right? 
[49]Oh, it's ah, just something I whipped up in the old garage workshop -- -- with a little help from my buddy Barney, right, Barn? 
[50]Well, Mr. Slate, I call it -- -- Barney, what do I call it? 
[51]-- I call it Fibrerock Fred -- ! I mean, ah, 'Fibrerock'! 
[52]Just be thankful I was there to go over the fine print. It's like I told you this morning -- There's something noble about a man digging in with his hands and doing an honest day's work. Once you file those dreams under 'old business' and put your nose to the plow, well, the world is your oyster. And was I right? 
[53]Details, Barney, details... I just can't wait to see the girls' faces when we tell 'em the news... 
[54]Why? Oh, me and Barn, we suddenly realized that we had a little spare change. 
[55]Noogy, noogy, ha, ha -- ! 
[56]Ready when you are. Hey, '1'... a good year. 
[57]We see your dollar signs, ladies... and... 
[58]... we raise them. 
[59]You bet they're real, sweetheart. They're as real as... as... well, as real as -- -- the best darn friends and neighbors in the whole world. 
[60]Right, pal o'mine. 
[61]wooden, then confident 
[62]-- crucible with our fur fluffy and our hooves unscathed. Now, the future holds many promises and many problems. As your next Herdmaster, I would bring to you the same determination, courage and -- if I may say so -- bold thinking that I have brought to the workplace. Thank you, and ack ack a-dack. 
[63]Hey, when you're hot you're hot... boys, lemme buy a round of drinks for everyone. 
[64]But the principle is the same, Barn. Don't forget that. 
[65]Here you go, boys, nice and frosty... 
[66]Well, here's to... 
[67]Here's to the greatest bunch of lifelong Buffaloes a guy could dream of leading. Anybody else got a toast...? 
[68]Aw, gee, Barn... you shouldn't say that... ... at least not till after next week's election! 
[69]Well, Harry, it just so happens that old Fred is moving up in the world... Boys, you're looking at Mr. Slate's new partner. 
[70]Prepare to eat those words, Piltdown. 
[71]Gentlemen, my card -- 
[72]Barney, it's all part of the plan. Yes, boys, you see, I went up to my pal, Mister Slate and single- handedly made him an offer he couldn't refuse -- 
[73]-- 'Freddy boy,' he sez to me, 'We gotta talk turkey -- ' 
[74]That's right -- just like that -- 
[75]Ah, excuse us, boys... 
[76]Barney, we could tell everyone how you invented this Fibrerock stuff, how Slate and Lava found out about it by accident and all, but what would that be? 
[77]This is big business, Barney. We can't start telling the truth, it'd create the wrong impression. Think about all the really big deals in history -- back to the beginning of recorded time. 
[78]What do they all have in common? I'll tell you. A front man. A guy who's out in the public eye running the point, fighting the crowds... and meanwhile... back in the corner is the silent partner. 
[79]That's because the silent partner is always silent. 
[80]But while you're busy being silent -- -- all along you're the brains behind the operation and I'm the brains in front of the operation. I'm out here running the guts of the operation but you got a cut. It looks like my mind, but you're really behind. 
[81]Attaboy! 
[82]Yeah... it does feel a little light... 
[83]Aw, Wilma... lookit, it's got buckles, a strap, a lock -- 
[84]-- Baby, you're the greatest. 
[85]I'm already taken. 
[86]Ah, Mister Rubble, I presume? Of the Fibrerock Rubbles? 
[87]Yas, yas. The water was too deep and my horse drowned. 
[88]Gets the old adrenaline going, Barn. Us big executives, we need that kind of jolt to get the old wheels turning. 
[89]Hey.   What's going on? 
[90]Yes, yes. Quick, dynamic entry into the marketplace. I approve. 
[91]Hey, you're right... ... Big business is hell, Barney. Trust me... you'll get used to it. 
[92]Welcome to the top -- partner. 
[93]I do? I mean, I do, yeah! 
[94]Mr. Slate -- we gotta talk -- 
[95]About those guys outside, Mr. Slate. Some of 'em, well, they been here for years. And you, well, you can't lay them off just like -- -- that! 
[96]Oh, you can, huh? 
[97]Me! Ah, ha, that's rich, Mr. Slate, that's -- 
[98]Uh... well, gee, I... uh, yeah. 
[99]Akkk... something... noble... man ... job... nose... wheel... shoulder... grindstone... hommm... yggggg... 
[100]Since when do you have to prepare for a landslide, right, guys? 
[101]Barn -- w-what's going on? 
[102]Guys, guys, come on now -- what's a quarry fulla layoffs got to do with a lodge fulla Buffaloes? 
[103]Fellas, come on. We're all big boys here -- 
[104]Surely we can separate in our minds work, and play... Job, and Lodge... 
[105]Wait, wait... Your Antlerness, please, one second -- ! 
[106]Barney, you gotta tell the other guys what really happened. Tell 'em the story behind Fibrerock. The true story. 
[107]No, no, the rest --! 
[108]Big deal, after you screwed everything up in the first place...! 
[109]No kidding. They rejected the best candidate -- 
[110]Oh, no! That -- that's horrible! We could end up with half a percent of nothing! 
[111]Oh, yeah, yeah, that, too... come on, Barn, we gotta stop 'em! 
[112]I don't believe this... how did things ever get this out of hand -- ? 
[113]Well, I wouldn't go that far... 
[114]Oh, no, not now... 
[115]Barn! Did you see that -- ? -- Huh, now it's gone... I coulda sworn... 
[116]Brother Piltdown... can we talk about this, antler to antler? 
[117]Guess not... 
[118]Dare you to cross that line. 
[119]That line. 
[120]I don't wanna talk about it. Besides, who cares about a bunch of jerks running around with furs on their heads? I'm more of a country club guy myself anyway... 
[121]... But Barney doesn't want to take a vacation -- he says he's gotta be here to check up on the Fibrefoam -- 
[122]Of course not, Mister Lava. But -- 
[123]Why, yeah, sure, Jerry. 
[124]Well, actually, I wouldn't say small part... I'd say... 
[125]... Kind of a medium-sized... well, almost medium-sized... well, really a semi-partial assistant counsulting type, of -- 
[126]Well, gee, that's tough one -- -- Uh, what are my important duties? 
[127]R-rockin' Leach? 
[128]M-me?   On -- on television? 
[129]Barney who? 
[130]W-what's wrong? 
[131]Maybe you could move those plants to block them out...? 
[132]It's the Rubble yard, Wilma.   It's just not the right image... 
[133]Well, Rockin', you're right, I have affected destiny for all mankind, and it's a sobering thought. However, if I may add a personal note at this time, I myself cannot personally take all the credit for Fibrerock... 
[134]No, I could never have done it without the inspiration and support of a very special person. I'm speaking, of course, of my close friend and associate, Mister Slate, founder and C.E.O. of Slate Construction... 
[135]Hello, hello. Bon soir. Good to see ya... glad you could make it... 
[136]Fred -- there's the bar, make yourself at home -- mi casa es votre casa, so, when in Rome and all that -- 
[137]You mean you can see their house -- ? 
[138]Wilma, I'm shocked. I wouldn't do that. Okay, I admit it: I'm trying to make an impression here, I wanna look good, I wanna be a success... 
[139]... But deep down inside, I'm still the same lovable guy you married -- -- Frederick von Flintstone the third -- 
[140]What'd I say? 
[141]... Yas, yas, it's a challenging commodity market these days. Personally, I'm considering petrified forests, but they do say that volcano futures are ready to explode, ha, ha... 
[142]... Hey, whoa, what's happening -- 
[143]Fred! 
[144]Hey, what's the hurry? We got a cake shaped like a piece of Fibrerock... I got it, how about some charades? No, even better, twenty questions: 'Am I animal, mineral, or fossil'...? Oh, I heard a great one the other day ... a guy walks in a bar with a duckasaurus on his head and the bartender says -- this'll kill you, the bartender says -- 
[145]Whaddya mean, not working out? They're goin' party hopping, that's all. That's what ya do in society, Wilma... you cruise around. They'll go over to Slate's shindig for a while, then they'll come back here. 
[146]You go on over to Slate City, okay? 
[147]Nah, me and some of the guys from the country club, we're gonna play poker, yeah, big stakes poker until everybody comes back. Go on with the others. The kids got their show to put on anyway... and I wouldn't want people to think... to think the Flintstones were party poopers. 
[148]Just you and me now, Dino. Yeah. That's okay. Man and man's best friend. 
[149]B... Barney? 
[150]'Pal'? How can you call me that? Barney, I... I've been such a... such a... such a... 
[151]Well, yeah.   But more of a -- 
[152]Well -- 
[153]Barney... can... can you ever forgive me for being such a jerk? 
[154]Aw, Barn... 
[155]Boy, those were the days, Barney. Bedrock High winning all those games... and you and me right in the middle of it. 
[156]So what? We made the team spirit. That's just as important... whatever happened to those cheerleader costumes? 
[157]Boy.    Talk about memories. 
[158]Back then, we thought a pop quiz was a big problem. We didn't know how good we had it. No problems, no worries... 
[159]What for? So him and all his fancy friends can look down their noses at us? 
[160]All they've been doing is using us, Barney. And meanwhile -- 
[161]-- Meanwhile all the time they were laughing at us. 
[162]About an hour ago. 
[163]Wha... what's happening? 
[164]Your old models are just fine... 
[165]What's it? 
[166]But.. why would -- 
[167]-- Not 'somebody' -- Lava! 
[168]Then... what's happening here... 
[169]Oh no... Barney! Wilma and Betty -- and the kids -- they're all there -- 
[170]-- B-barney... what do we do? 
[171]What'll we do when we get there? 
[172]Barney -- ! -- I can't see straight -- 
[173]Ho, gweat! Hoo bwoke hit, Bahnee! Hi khnat twalk hennymore! 
[174]Ho noh! Ahhrisser Felghspah! Haybee whee hould shtop -- ? 
[175]'Hen yore height, yore height... 
[176]'Ood hidea.   Ood whuk, ol' bhudee. 
[177]Offisser Fledapar, het me hexpwain -- his howse hiss maid uv fibahwock -- 
[178]Nogh, wate, chum baggk -- 
[179]Barney!    The elevator -- ! 
[180]Quick!    Use your coo-coo gun -- ! 
[181]It's real simple, Mister Slate. Your boy Lava here has been stealing the coo-coo berries from the Fibrerock mix and fixing the books to hide it! 
[182]Now I remember! These guys were pulling this xenosaurus act that night at the plant! What's this, Lava... 'Plan B'? 
[183]Y-yeah. Everything's gonna be just -- Whoa, hoo-hah, aggh -- 
[184]-- Wait a minute -- I don't feel anything at all -- 
[185]Hist hust fine! 
[186]Hit fuzz nudding... wheely... 
[187]Upsy-daisy, sweetheart -- piggy back time! 
[188]Hohh... GWEAT! 
[189]Wilmagh, I jusght whunt to sagh thad I knogh shumtimes I dogh dumb thinks... Bhut hit's becaughse high luff yough sogh much thaght high whant yough to livgh likge a pwincess orgh a qween 'cause you reaally arggh rugg aaggg hummmmg higga! 
[190]Lhet's dogh it! 
[191]High ham noght a zenosore! High ham hay hooman beeng -- ! 
[192]Barn...?    What's going on? 
[193]Dino kibble...? 
[194]Dhinough khibble!! 
[195]Barney, we -- we're rich! Yabba dabba do -- ! 
[196]Wilma...? ... Wilma? 
[197]Wilma?   Wil-ma --!
dialogues.BARNEY:
[1]Nice morning, huh, Fred? 
[2]Heh, hey. That Arnold's got a real arm on him, don't he? 
[3]Ah, well, that appliance store and me, we kinda had a little adjustment -- 
[4]Fred, don't start on me again.    I donno, I'm just not a nine to five guy. I got dreams, Fred. Ideas -- 
[5]I invented fire. 
[6]I told you that, Fred. But the coal conglomerate ripped me off. The case is still in court, but meanwhile I got lotsa other ideas -- 
[7]Maybe, Fred.   But first... 
[8]Let me try some of that smoke on your car. 
[9]-- See, the first step, we make a mold of the old car hood, smooth out the dent in the clay -- 
[10]-- Add some lava granules... some woca leaves... juice from two coo-coo berries... 
[11]Anything for a pal, Fred -- a lump of coal... bamboo sawdust... eucalyptus sap... a touch of the La Brea tarbrush -- and -- voila. 
[12]Not bad, eh? After it cures for an hour or so, it's solid as a rock. 
[13]Did I ever? 
[14]You're a big man anywhere, Fred -- 
[15]Hey.   Lava Lane. 
[16]Yeah, those were the days... we usta dream about coming back here some day with a real car and goin' for the goldrock...! 
[17]Fred... I thought you said it was time to retire those old dreams. 
[18]Oh-oh! Fred, slow down -- ! 
[19]Gee, Fred. I knew you were a big shot. I just didn't know how big. 
[20]Social Security number... dependents... 'how learned of job' ... newspaper ad, carrier pigeon... ... Personal reference... 
[21]Hey, maybe you guys oughta fix that first. 
[22]It looks dangerous. Besides, you can kick Fred's fat butt anytime. 
[23]Hey, nice going, Fred.   You even got the spare -- 
[24]That's a lie, Mr. Slate! 
[25]B. Rubble. White male personal reference -- 
[26]Well, actually, Fred, it was the other way ar-- 
[27]Sure, Fred, right, right. 
[28]Fibrerock, Fred... 
[29]Gee, thanks, Mr. Slate. 
[30]Gee, Fred, I don't believe it. Eight hours ago I didn't have a job and now look -- I got 1/2 of one percent of the after-taxes after-expenses net breakage profits on Fibrerock! 
[31]No, Fred, you weren't. I didn't nose any grindstones and you didn't shoulder a wheel. We just hung out together and everything that happened was a total accident. 
[32]Betty, these are for you. For sticking beside me during the tough times, and well... for making a little guy feel like he was ten feet tall. 
[33]Hey. Fred does something stupid every day and I still love him. 
[34]Plenty more where that came from. 
[35]Yeah. And nothing's ever gonna change that... right, Fred? 
[36]Indeed we do, Brother Herdmaster. Tonight we are to hear speeches from prospective candidates for Lodge offices, such as good old Fred and some other guys. 
[37]My apologies, Brother Piltdown. Allow me to rephrase. Tonight we will hear speeches from a whole bunch of good old guys... ... plus the one and only Fred Flintstone! 
[38]-- crucible -- 
[39]Thanks, Fred, but here at the lodge drinks are free. 
[40]'Here's to the Water Buffalo and their next Herdmaster... Fred'! 
[41]Gee, Fred, how come I didn't get any business cards? 
[42]Fred, we gotta talk turkey -- 
[43]Fred -- ! 
[44]Fred... what's this single-handed stuff? I distinctly remember at least four hands and two of them were mine. 
[45]The truth? 
[46]Okay. 
[47]I never knew that. 
[48]I get it. I got the brains, but you just pretend to have them. 
[49]Thanks, Betty. What would I do without you? 
[50]Come on, Betty, it's only my first day. You have to have seniority to run off... 
[51]Yes, yes. Looking good, Mister Flintstone. I see you've recovered from that polo accident. 
[52]Gee, Fred, driving with you is better than an 'E' ticket at Magerock Mountain. 
[53]Oh, hi, Mister Lava. 
[54]But, Fred, it's right where the employee basketball court used ta be -- 
[55]I guess so.   You already did. 
[56]All-right! 
[57]Ready... aim... fibre! 
[58]Fred. You gotta do something about this! 
[59]That's my Fred... 
[60]Fred? 
[61]They're mad at you, Fred... it's understandable, I mean, they all got laid off today -- 
[62]Is that a riddle? Give me a second -- 
[63]Well, there's not much to tell. True, I got a cut... but Fred's got a gut. 
[64]Oh, yeah, I remember! I got the mind, but Fred's got the behind. Right, Fred? 
[65]I voted for you, Fred. 
[66]Fred! Fred! The Buffalo are heading for big trouble -- ! 
[67]No, no, not that! Piltdown's got the guys all worked up and they're heading down to the quarry! They're gonna wreck the assembly line! 
[68]No, Fred, if they do that they'll be breakin' the law! Our brother Buffalo could go to jail! 
[69]I know. Makes you wish things were back the way they were... before we was big executives. 
[70]Come on Fred.    Time to earn those big bucks. 
[71]Stee-rike one! Heh-hey.    Ready for a curve ball? 
[72]Give me your best shot. 
[73]Whattya know. Even got the spare again... 
[74]Excuse me, Mister Lava -- ? I think you oughta know... something could be wrong with the Fibrerock mix. 
[75]It tastes different. 
[76]Yup. See, ever since I started with Fibrerock -- I mean, since me and Fred started with it, I always take a little taste of the Fibre foam. And tonight's batch, well... I didn't get much of it, but it seems a little off. Can't fool the old taste buds, heh-heh. I think there might be an ingredient missing. So tomorrow, I'll run a couple of tests and stuff -- 
[77]Nine days, Mister Lava. 
[78]But -- 
[79]Ah, yup, yup, young feller... jest show me the way to the personnel office... I'm lookin' fer a job as a custodian... 
[80]Fred's in a high-powered executive job, Betty. There's a lot of pressure on him. 
[81]Trust me, Betty. After the Fibrerock debut, he'll be the same old Fred. 
[82]You mean beside Fred? 
[83]See?   What'd I tell ya? 
[84]Hiya, Fred. Boy, the rental place is gonna be mad... ... You feeling better, pal? 
[85]Creep? 
[86]Fool? 
[87]Slimeball? Louse? Jackass? Stuck-up blimpasaurus? 
[88]Sure, Fred. I've had lots of practice. 
[89]Yeah.   Too bad we never made the team. 
[90]You know Betty. She never throws anything away. 
[91]Speaking of problems and worries, shouldn't we get on over to Slate's party? 
[92]Yeah?   When did you notice that? 
[93]Boy, there's no fooling you, Fred. 
[94]I... I don't know... the Fibrerock it's... it's decomposing... but this shouldn't happen... 
[95]It should be. There's enough coo-coo berry resin in there to petrify a brontosaurus -- 
[96]-- The coo-coo berries! Fred, that's it! 
[97]Remember I said the Fibrefoam tasted funny? It was the coo-coo sap that was missing! 
[98]Why? Because coo-coo berries are as valuable as goldrock! And we've had tons of 'em delivered to the plant since we started... somebody musta got greedy -- 
[99]Fred, that sap acts as a fixative -- it's the glue that holds the whole formula together -- ! 
[100]... Is gonna happen for real in the real Slate City! 
[101]Coo-coo berry sap, Fred! It's our only chance -- their only chance! 
[102]We just tell Mister Slate that all 500 acres of his development are going to crumble into dust any minute. Then we zap the stairs and corridors with some of this coo-coo sap. I just hope we have enough to get everybody out -- whoops! 
[103]Hang on, hang on -- 
[104]What, and explain what you're doing in that costume? Start talking about coo-coo berries and Fibrerock? By then it'll be too late! 
[105]We'd better split up; that way at least one of us can make it to the Slate Needle -- ! 
[106]Fred, stop it! It might know the way inside! 
[107]Sure, pal. We just gotta wait for the fire department. Right, Fred? 
[108]It must be the suit, Fred -- old Bedrock High built them things to last -- 
[109]-- Okay? 
[110]Come on, everybody -- we'll go out the way we came! 
[111]Go on, honey... I got Bam-Bam! 
[112]You think there's gonna be some? 
[113]Lava Lava leaves... Woca sap... all still there, but now the nutrients are all released... ... Fred, this... this is Dino kibble!
dialogues.WILMA:
[1]Fred, stop playing with Dino and sit down. Your breakfast's getting cold. 
[2]So is everybody else in Bedrock. That kibble crisis is getting worse every day. 
[3]I'm afraid Dino's going to have to manage on leftovers from Pebbles and me. 
[4]I'll let you know when I see some. 
[5]Of course not, baby. 
[6]Lucky it wasn't the Sunday paper. 
[7]We're really going to miss you, too, Mrs. Granite. 
[8]Fortunately, we're both -- -- Professional shoppers! 
[9]Ah, hello, Mrs. Slate. 
[10]We met at the quarry picnic? 
[11]I just need a few things for Fred. 
[12]Flintstone -- 
[13]I'm sure. 
[14]Let me have one of those, too.   For ma petite Pebbles. 
[15]It's not like the boys to be so late. 
[16]Betty, sometimes you're a little too gullible -- 
[17]No kidding. Do you have any idea of what the enrollment fee is? And get this... it's non-refundable -- 
[18]Oh, she was getting to me too with all that mastodon snort about her little nephew... and... 
[19]And... if a friend can't help you do something stupid, who can? 
[20]What's wrong with the truth? 
[21]Maybe we could rephrase it... 
[22]Rock candy?   That's nice, but... why? 
[23]Not anymore you don't... 
[24]Have you been drinking? 
[25]Fred, there's no easy way to say this so -- 
[26]The non-refundable dollar signs? 
[27]Betty... these... these look... real -- 
[28]Fred! Wait a minute! There's something wrong with your lunch -- 
[29]Fit for a king... my king. 
[30]Good luck. Watch out for those... you know... hostile takeovers. 
[31]You don't have to win... honorable mention or most Kongenial Kids is perfectly acceptable. 
[32]Young lady, this is not about beating pants, this is about becoming a well rounded child. Now, what kind of act will you do? 
[33]I think they're ready for Rock Vegas. 
[34]Fred, is there something you want to tell me about the lodge meeting? 
[35]Fred, this was supposed to be a 'typical evening' at the Flintstones, and you invited fifty people I don't even know. Now what's going on? Where are they taking my ficus-sauruses? 
[36]Thank heaven. There isn't one person I know here. 
[37]I mean including Fred. 
[38]Fred, can I talk to you -- ? Fred? Fred? We have a serious problem with Betty and Barney. 
[39]I mean you're treating them horribly! What's come over you, Fred? Does a little money mean so much to you that you just turn your back on the things that really count? 
[40]Arrrgh -- ! 
[41]Fred... I... I'm sorry it's not working out... 
[42]Fred... 
[43]Fred, I want to be here with you -- 
[44]Come on, Pebbles. We're going to another party. 
[45]We'll find out together. 
[46]Why? 
[47]Uh... thank you... I think. 
[48]Oh?   Is Fred getting promoted? 
[49]Yeah -- a zoo where the animals are dead -- because if they aren't, they will be! 
[50]Fred!   There's a fire hose -- ! 
[51]Oh, Fred -- that's the most beautiful thing I've ever heard! 
[52]Yes! Yes! Betty, we have to try it -- ! Dino! Dino, look down here -- !
dialogues.LAVA:
[1]Uncle, if you'll look at this unit cost projection... it intersects here with -- 
[2]You'll be bankrupt in six months. 
[3]It's all here in hack and slice. When you committed to this housing development the price of dino kibble was a few clams per ton. Since then, it's gone up a hundredfold. You can't build a project like this without the heavy equipment dinos, and we can't afford to feed those dinos. 
[4]Sounds like a worker's comp claim if I ever heard one... 
[5]Uncle, Uncle, speak to me -- 
[6]Eighths -- 
[7]Ivan, look, okay, so I bought too much on margin... everyone said glaciers were here to stay, I mean, who knew? Just leverage my shares in Atlantis dry goods and -- what? When did that happen? 
[8]Armored car...? 
[9]I... I'll get back to you. 
[10]Piltdown, this Fibrerock program is going to create a lot of changes around the plant. I want to make one more. You've been a wonderful thug and goon for me. Now, I'd like to expand your duties. I want you to become a provocateur. 
[11]What I mean, is, I'm going to use you to double-cross your Lodge and Union brothers, and make their lives a living hell. 
[12]Good. You and your little pal will report directly to me and take orders only from me. Now get out of here and start screwing your former friends and associates. 
[13]Coo-coo berries... 
[14]Flintstone!   Rubble! 
[15]Please, call me Jerry. Uncle -- I mean, Mister Slate told me to take you to your offices. If you'll follow me...? 
[16]The Fibrerock  assembly line. Unc -- Mister  Slate's had a crew working on it  all weekend. We're going to roll  out the first sheets of Fibrerock  by mid-week. 
[17]Well, gentlemen, here you are. As soon as you're settled, come over to the assembly line. We'll go over the Fibrerock formula before the first run. 
[18]Of course he can, Flintstone. It's his quarry. 
[19]A simple little heist -- I gave you everything but the keys and you blew it -- 
[20]The day after Slate City opens there's going to be an audit. If the stuff isn't gone by then we'll all be doing time until the Bronze Age. 
[21]How do you know that? I mean... ah, why do you say that? 
[22]Tastes... different? 
[23]Rubble, Rubble! We're fighting a deadline to finish Slate City... and we're not pulling the plug on production to satisfy your tastebuds! If you ask me, you and your tastebuds are overworked ... overwrought... how long have you been with us, anyway? 
[24]Jumping Jurrasic, no wonder you're so run down. 
[25]I'm authorizing a nice vacation for you, Rubble. Starting tomorrow. You can catch some rays, maybe invent something... hey, how about Fibrerock, the sequel, part II -- ? 
[26]No, don't try and thank me. 
[27]... As you can see, the Fibrerock is so light we're using it for construction, for furnishings... for everything. You can't stack a two-bedroom cave this high... but the sky's the limit with Fibrerock! 
[28]That's brilliant, Unc... Mister Slate. In fact, maybe you can help me with the centerpiece of the complex... ... I wanna call 'em the FibreSphere and the '____' something Needle... but I just can't... 
[29]'Slate Need...' ... How do you keep coming up with these? It's uncanny. 
[30]Oh, that reminds me, sign these, will you... just a few overruns ... minor cost problems... that's it... thank you... 
[31]... Oh, Mister Slate, we're going to hold the Bedrock Junior Talent Show in the uh, 'Slate Needle.' Good for public relations -- 
[32]That takes care of the half-pint. Now to deal with the half-wit. 
[33]-- Oh? Or check up on us? 
[34]Flintstone, that... that's a slap in the face of our founder... our employer... our uncle. Unless, of course, you agree with Rubble... that Mister Slate isn't capable of running this operation ... that I'm not capable of running it? 
[35]Call me Jerry. Sit down, please... 
[36]... Cigar? 
[37]Fred, let me get to the bottom slime. Some men -- you and me, for instance -- we're cut out for the big time, the big bucks... ... the big everything. 
[38]And others?   Wellll... 
[39]... Now, I know your pal Barney had a small part in the preliminary research and development of Fibrerock... 
[40]Yes? 
[41]You're too kind, Flintstone, that's what I like about you. But you're a big guy with a big decision to make. Are you gonna keep covering for Barney, keep pulling his acornsauruses out of the fire... or are you going to concentrate on your own important duties? 
[42]Publicity, Flintstone, publicity! 
[43]And that's why I've got a little surprise for you... for the man who made Fibrerock a household word, I want you to meet the man who's going to make you a household word... 
[44]Right, Fred. As long as you forget all this nonsense about Barney. 
[45]Of course, Poindexter, of course. 
[46]You're certainly looking lovely this evening, Mrs. Flintstone. Life with a junior executive must agree with you. 
[47]Yes. I think so, too. Imagine how good you'd look with a senior executive. 
[48]That's ridiculous, Flintstone! Nobody could get that many coo-coo berries off our premises! 
[49]They're convincing fakes, Mrs. Rubble -- part of our exciting display -- 
[50]Uncle! Are you going to stand there while aspersions are being cast at the Slate family? This is absurd -- 
[51]All right, all right, I admit it! I got in over my head in the stock market... took some big losses... I had these guys pull jobs for me all over town disguised as a monster... but it still wasn't enough... and when I saw all those coo-coo berries being delivered every day, I guess I just lost my head... I figured with the Woca sap in the Fibremix, the berry juice as superfluous... 
[52]Yeah. Real chip off the old block, ain't he?
dialogues.SLATE:
[1]-- how'd you like my fist to intersect with your nose? I've told you a hundred times, don't call me uncle in the office! Now, I didn't arrange your scholarship to Harvrock University so you could waste my time! So stop beating around the bushasaurus and get to the bottom slime! 
[2]Bankrupt?   Are you crazy? 
[3]I'm two months behind schedule, my option's running out on the land and Donald Trumprock is just waiting to jump in and steal the whole deal ... meanwhile that damn union's on my back, hell, they'll probably want an eighty hour week or something... There's got to be an answer... 
[4]What's that? 
[5]I'm over here, you moron -- and don't call me 'Uncle'! 
[6]For five years Slate Construction has had the finest safety record in Bedrock. Our workers are trained in first aid, our equipment is first rate and our dinos are worm free. And then something like this happens ... I want to know how! 
[7]Shut up! I want one person to answer me: Who's responsible for this? 
[8]Who are you? 
[9]Flintstone, I have just one thing to say to you -- 
[10]Congratulations! 
[11]This stuff you had on your car is the most incredible building material I've seen in thirty years in the construction business! It's strong -- -- Light -- -- Resilient -- 
[12]Where on earth did you get it? 
[13]The rest of you men go back to work. I want to talk to Flintstone and the personal reference alone. Come on, move, move... 
[14]Light  as a Pterodactyl feather... why, a  child could handle this... Lava,  we could cut construction costs  in half... in quarters... in uh...  whatchacallit -- 
[15]Eighths, right. Flintstone, what do you call this stuff? 
[16]'Fibrerock'? 'Fibrerock'? 'Fib-bre-rock' -- 
[17]I love it! 
[18]You see this, Lava? All those courses of yours at Harvrock University, and who saves my bacon? Two simple-minded run-of-the-mill nobodies. 
[19]Boys, this is a small step for Slate Construction... a giant step for all mankind. 
[20]The Stone Age is over!    Let the Fibre Age begin! 
[21]Men, this is a proud day for Slate Construction. You have seen the first pieces of Fibrerock roll off the assembly line and into history... a history you are all part of... thanks to your very own fellow worker, Fred Flintstone! 
[22]No longer will man and beast bend under the backbreaking load of stone and rock and timber... because Fibrerock is so light that even a child can handle it. That's why on Monday we're going to hire two dozen children from Bedrock Technical Junior High. They'll be replacing the 36 heavy equipment operators, 15 shaft diggers and 22 laborers we're laying off today. Your pink slips will be in your final pay envelopes along with a ticket to the grand opening of Slate City. It's non-transferable, so hang on to it. Thank you, and have a nice weekend. 
[23]Flintstone! 
[24]We do, eh?   About what? 
[25]Of course I can, Fred. I can lay them off like -- -- that, or like -- -- that, or like -- 
[26]-- that. 
[27]That's right. Why -- I could lock the front door and go fishing if I wanted! 
[28]Why, I could even fire Lava here if I wanted. 
[29]Or... I could fire you, Fred. 
[30]Flintstone, Lava, here, recommended that you be in charge of public relations to get Fibrerock off to a good start. I'm a member of that public, Flintstone, and I have to say... this isn't a good start. I'm getting a bad feeling about Fibrerock. A bad feeling about... you. You want that feeling to go away, don't you? 
[31]Good. Then turn around and walk out of here and we'll forget all about this. 
[32]'Sky's the limit'... 'sky's the limit'... why, these two buildings, they... they practically scrape the sky! We should call them... Slate scrapers! 
[33]How about, 'Slate Needle'? 
[34]It's a gift... 
[35]What the devil's going on here? 
[36]Of course it is! Why, without the coo-coo berry sap, Fibrerock would be completely -- -- unstable... 
[37]I'll tell you what's superfluous, Lava... your liver! So why don't we remove it -- ! 
[38]Flintstone. Rubble. I... I don't know what to say. I... I treated you horribly... I ignored you, abused you... and then you come here and risk your necks like this... well, there's no price you can put on something like that, so I won't even try. But let me give you... ... a hearty handshake. 
[39]Honey, you're being hysterical, go lie down, okay? 
[40]Okay, okay. Boys, I'm feeling guilty about how you've been taken advantage of, so I'll tell you what... I'm going to give you back all world-wide rights to Fibrerock, free and clear. 
[41]Your only obligation will be to cover oh, whatever legal expenses might surface at some later time... 
[42]Oh, you never know...
dialogues.BETTY:
[1]Come on, kids. Time for nursery school. 
[2]... Oh, it's not that I'm complaining, Wilma. I mean, Barney's sweet, but... well, he's just not cut out to punch a clock. And he's such a dreamer, you think he ever once picked up a hammer and chisel and tried to balance a checkbook? 
[3]No, Barney just keeps looking for that coo-coo berry pie in the sky, and I don't want to pop his balloon by talking about the price of mastodon ribs. 
[4]You're welcome, Mrs. Granite. But we wipe their mouths every day. 
[5]We're still shopping around. 
[6]Morris, what on earth is going on? You giving away Bronto filets? 
[7]Oh, I'd like some ground mammoth patties and uh... some dodo drumsticks. 
[8]Here we are, Mrs. Slate.       Sorry you had to ride in the back. 
[9]Likewise. 
[10]That's right, you don't understand. My husband's business manager usually handles this sort of thing, but I don't mind. 
[11]I know Bam-Bam -- -- pardonez-moi, 'Bem-Bem' will love attending your school and performing in the talent show. Thank you oh so much. 
[12]Unless they were forced to go bowling again. Remember that time a burglar pointed a gun at them and said, 'go bowling right now'? 
[13]Don't tell me. I still can't believe what I did today... 
[14]I know, I know! I just couldn't stand that woman's attitude! But we had to find a new school anyway, and there we were... the next thing I knew, I was in over my head... but why did you jump in, too? 
[15]And? 
[16]What do we tell the boys? 
[17]We put ourselves in debt so the kids can attend school with a family we can't stand? 
[18]Flowers? 
[19]Aw, Barney... I... I don't deserve these. I did something really stupid today. 
[20]Boys... did you see... the dollar signs there at the bottom? 
[21]Barney, wait a minute... 
[22]There. That looks more like a captain of industry. 
[23]Hmm. Probably run off to the tropics with one of those executive secretaries. 
[24]Well, you're both going to change your plans. Your new school is going to have a talent show... and you're going to have some talent. 
[25]We're waiting. 
[26]Well? Think they're ready for the talent show? 
[27]Barney, I don't understand... what came over you boys? 
[28]I don't know why you want to go to this thing... after the way Fred's been treating you lately -- 
[29]Yeah... and it's all around his belt. If it wasn't for poor Wilma I wouldn't give him the Geological Time -- 
[30]Wilma, wait.   I'm going with you. 
[31]If friends can't do something stupid, who can? 
[32]Besides... ... Maybe if we leave the boys alone...? 
[33]A circus, huh? Well, if our kids belong in a circus with their act, then your little nephew belongs in a zoo with his -- 
[34]These sure look like coo-coo berries to me -- 
[35]Barney... tonight you're the biggest man in Bedrock. 
[36]W-wilma... those hoops of bamboo... those wires... do you think -- ?
dialogues.PILTDOWN:
[1]Yer on, Pyrite -- 
[2]Yeah?   Sez who? 
[3]Yeah? Well, A.N.W. one-oh-one gives us workers a snack break. So... ... I'm breakin' some snacks. 
[4]You've been asking for this, Flintstone... I'm gonna kick your fat butt -- 
[5]Why should we? 
[6]It was Flintstone, Mr. Slate! 
[7]You bet I do. How come Flintstone is 'good old Fred' and me and the other candidates are just 'some other guys'? 
[8]You and Slate? Who are you kidding, Flintstone? The only partner you got is hanging over your belt. 
[9]-- If I don't, you will -- 
[10]Mister Lava, the armored car is here. 
[11]Yeah. Must be a fortune in coo-coo berries on that baby. You know, for that Fibrerock stuff of Flintstone and Rubble's. You gotta sign here for it. 
[12]Gee, Mister Lava, I donno.   I kinda like girls myself. 
[13]Oh, okay. 
[14]-- You mean used to work for him -- until somebody opened their big mouth -- 
[15]Candidate and double-crossing back stabber? Herdmaster! I move we commence the meeting... and the election! 
[16]Thank you, Brother Chairman. Fellow Buffaloes, I'm a man of few words. It's no secret that most of our lodge members are also members of Amalgamated Neolithic 101... which means that most of us aren't gonna be able to make our cave payments next month. So my agenda for tonight... ends right now. There's a time to be a Buffalo... there's a time ta be a brown nosin' double-crossin' creep... 
[17]... and there's a time to stand up and be a man! So let's go down there and make the Slate shop into slate scrap... then we'll see how he gets along without the heavy equipment operators of Neolithic 101! Meeting adjourned! 
[18]Okay! Let's start with Slate's golf trophies and work our way up to the assembly line! 
[19]Now we'll show 'em who's boss! 
[20]Not if we give 'em a nice long vacation... in the hospital. 
[21]Hey, we got the union guys to break in and create a distraction, didn't we? Who knew Flintstone and Rubble would show up, too? 
[22]Can we help you... sir? 
[23]Ya can start by cleaning the street with your pants! 
[24]Pyrite, shaddup --
dialogues.FELDSPAR:
[1]Well, Flintstone, looks like today's the day. 
[2]Forget it, Flintstone. This time I got you dead to rights -- 
[3]Gravel. Get me the radar reading and I'll show you how we deal with scofflaws. 
[4]Flintstone!   Flintstone, come back here -- ! 
[5]Flintstone!   Pull over! 
[6]All right!   You're all under arr -- 
[7]Speed traps again! Face it, Gravel. I'm in a rut... and meanwhile, the guys who went through the academy with me, they're all big shots now: Sam Slate... Dirty Harock... Magma, P.I. And you know why? 'Cause they got the breaks, that's why! 
[8]There's a lesson there, Gravel... never pick up hitchhikers. Besides -- -- Did you say 'creature'? The xenosaurus! 
[9]This is a xenosaurus alert. Repeat, a xenosaurus alert. The creature has been sighted on the Slate City exit of the Venturock Freeway! It is driving a brown late model sedan and eating a white male Caucasian. Car twelve is in hot pursuit. 
[10]Oh, yeay... over and out! 
[11]Gravel, this could mean promotions for both of us! Load the shotgun and turn on the siren! 
[12]You kidding? By now he's a couple of shinbones and a belch. 
[13]Okay, lizard, reach for the sky! 
[14]Quivering quartzite, d-did you see that -- 
[15]Chief, you -- you gotta believe me -- just one swipe of its paw and -- wham -- a whole house was pre-history -- ! 
[16]You see -- ? I told you -- 
[17]Artillery. 
[18]It's the xenosaurus -- stand back, men -- it's a vicious killer -- Ready -- Aim --
dialogues.HERDMASTER:
[1]Attention, fellow Water Buffaloes... 
[2]Brothers, your attention! 
[3]The herd is now called to the prairie. Antlers... up! 
[4]This meeting of the Water Buffaloes is now in session. Sergeant-at-Arms, have we got any old business? 
[5]Brother Piltdown: You have given the Cry of the Gelded Buffalo at the Poisoned Water Hole. Do you wish to file an objection? 
[6]Fellow Water Buffalo. In a few moments we will cast our votes for the lodge officers. 
[7]The election committee will make the preparations. 
[8]All in favor, say -- 
[9]Thank you, Brother Rubble. The Buffaloes will now have their secret vote. Fit... furs! 
[10]Paw... ground! 
[11]All for Piltdown, bellow now! 
[12]All for Flintstone, bellow now! 
[13]Order furs! 
[14]The snorts have it! Brother Piltdown, it is my privilege to install you as the new Exalted Herdmaster Erect Antler and Big Buck of our Lodge. If you'll come forward, I will present you with the tokens of office.
dialogues.PYRITE:
[1]Way ta go, Pilty baby. Five bucks says you can't hit one on the fly. 
[2]That's right, Mr. Slate, it was Flintstone! 
[3]Yeah, how come? 
[4]Ah, it's probably a phony... 
[5]I'll tell ya what! Mosta the guys in this lodge work for Mr. Slate -- 
[6]I second the motion! 
[7]They can't push us around! 
[8]Darn that Flintstone and Rubble... they're gonna screw everything up... 
[9]Reject, huh? Whaddya say we reject your head? 
[10]Don't worry, Mister Lava... we're on top of it. 
[11]Our pleasure. 
[12]Fakes? Gee, Pilty, I thought the real ones were gonna be moved up here for us ta steal -- whatta waste a time --
dialogues.MORRIS:
[1]Ah, my two loveliest customers. It's this darn kibble crisis, Mrs. R... people are buying everything I got to feed their dinos... 
[2]Of course, Mrs. Slate.   Just take a number. 
[3]Ladies, the meat's not getting any fresher. Mrs. R, what'll it be? 
[4]Gino?   We got any dodo bird? 
[5]Good. Give it to Mrs. Rubble along with this. 
[6]How about you, Mrs. F? 
[7]'Fred...'? David! Herman! Get Rob and BoBo and tell 'em to bring the big dolly! 
[8]You got it. Now then... Mrs. Slate? You're in a no parking zone there. 
[9]Mrs. Slate, we're kind of busy now -- 
[10]Boys, you heard her... she said fresh.
dialogues.HEADMISTRESS:
[1]Madame Mrs. Slate, bonjour! Welcome to L'ecole des Enfants Prehistorique Haute Superior! 
[2]Enchante. 
[3]Well, Madame Slate, as you can see, we remain ze creme de la creme in the croissant of life known as Bedrock. Now, your leetle gran' nephew will be wiz us for two weeks, no? Here is ze application for him. An' mais oui, he weel participate in zee annual talent show, naturalment? 
[4]An' your friends perhaps would like zum school applications for zere enfants? 
[5]Of course. Any friend of Madame Slate is a friend of mine. 
[6]Sank you, ladies and gentlemen. An' sank you, Monsieur Slate for zis lovely setting. Zoot alors, zis will ze mos' fantas'tic recital in Bedrock 'istoree. Now, I would like to sank out mos' generous benefactress, Madame Slate for her fine support o'vair zee years -- 
[7]-- An' now, what better introduction could we 'ave for Mrs. Slate's vairy own gran' nephew... Poindexter Lava! 
[8]Sank you, sank you. Our nex' performance is Bam-Bam, Pebbles... ... an' friend. 
[9]Madame Slate, what ees wrong -- ? 
[10]Oh, geez, we're all gonna croak -- I neva shoulda left Far Rockaway --
dialogues.PEBBLES:
[1]Mommy, is the bad Ze-ze-zenosaurus gonna get me and eat me up? 
[2]I'm still a little scared... 
[3]'Bye-bye, Daddy. 
[4]But, Mommy, I wanna go roller skating... 
[5]As long as we beat the pants offa Mrs. Slate's nephew... 
[6]But then we'd need a hammer             BAM-BAM and chisel... oh, what about    That dumb thing?   You that thing with Dino?           think so...? 
[7]Okay. We're gonna sing a song with Dino. 
[8]A one-and-a-two and-a -- 
[9]Will there be real food there?
dialogues.LEACH:
[1]'Ello,  Fred. I've 'eard a lot h'about  you from Mister Lava. H'at's  why we're going to put you on our  program. 
[2]Hmm. Lovely little guest 'ouse, Mister Flintstone. So simple, so ordinary, so unexceptional... why, h'it's almost quaint. Let's say we start with the camera 'ere, except... 
[3]Well, just look at that yard over there... barbecues and trikes, not exactly the right image... 
[4]Good idea. Rodney, get 'hoppin' with those greens. 
[5]Good evening. Tonight we come to you live from the ah... charming pied a terre of the man of the 'our, Fred Flintstone -- 
[6]'Ere we are at the 'ome of Bedrock's man o' the 'our, Frederick Flint-- 
[7]'Ere we are at the fabulous 'ome of Bedrock's man o' the 'our, Frederick von Flintstone -- 
[8]Frederick, of course, is the man behind Fibrerock -- the invention that some predict will revolutionize life in the future. Frederick, 'ow does it feel to know that you 'ave personally brought the Stone Age as we know it to a long-deserved end? 
[9]Fabulous! I've 'ad enough crab meat and crabgrass to last me a year. All right, boys, that's a wrap!
dialogues.RADIO WOODPECKER:
[1]I hate this job... There's not even a health plan... 
[2]Good morning, Bedrock. This is station B-R-O-K with the morning weather and news... 
[3]It will be fair and mild through the weekend, continuing for the next eight hundred years, followed by cooling breezes and a protracted ice age... 
[4]In the news, Bedrock civic and business leaders met yesterday to discuss the growing kibble crisis. 
[5]In other news, Bedrock police report that the Xenosaurus has struck again! Yes, the fiercesome intruder was sighted in the Bedrock Hills for the third time this month. Outlying shops and residencies report extensive looting and property destruction... 
[6]... Scientists from B.C. University report that the footprints of the Xenosaurus match no known animal.
dialogues.GRAVEL:
[1]Sarge!   Look out -- ! 
[2]S-sarge, d-did you see that? Some sorta creature was attacking that little guy -- ! 
[3]No sign of the driver... 
[4]Holy cowasaurus! Look how deep these tracks are! That xeno thing must weigh a ton! 
[5]O-one flick of his paw... and he knocked down a wall -- ! 
[6]Hey, those are the biggest shorts I've ever seen... ... It... it must be Mister Flintstone! Cease fire! Gee, Sarge, now you don't have to shoot him -- !
